name: Sodium Hypochlorite (Bleach)
shortDescription: Chlorine-based oxidizing bleach used for whitening and disinfection.
uses: Mildew/mold removal, sanitizing siding, decks, concrete; organic stain removal.
precautions: Corrosive to skin/eyes; produces toxic gases if mixed with acids or ammonia; wear gloves, goggles, and respirator for fumes; control runoff.
mixingNote: Typically diluted for surface cleaning; follow product label for concentration.

name: Sodium Percarbonate (Oxygen Bleach)
shortDescription: Oxygen-based powdered bleach that releases hydrogen peroxide.
uses: Brightening wood and concrete; gentler mold/algae removal alternative to chlorine.
precautions: Oxidizer; eye/skin irritant; keep dry in storage; use gloves and goggles.
mixingNote: Dissolve per manufacturer's instructions; active at warm temperatures.

sdsURL.name: Sodium Hypochlorite (Bleach)
sdsURL.shortDescription: Chlorine-based oxidizing bleach used for whitening and disinfection.
sdsURL.uses: Mildew/mold removal, sanitizing siding, decks, concrete; organic stain removal.
sdsURL.precautions: Corrosive to skin/eyes; produces toxic gases if mixed with acids or ammonia; wear gloves, goggles, and respirator for fumes; control runoff.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Typically diluted for surface cleaning; follow product label for concentration.

sdsURL.name: Sodium Percarbonate (Oxygen Bleach)
sdsURL.shortDescription: Oxygen-based powdered bleach that releases hydrogen peroxide.
sdsURL.uses: Brightening wood and concrete; gentler mold/algae removal alternative to chlorine.
sdsURL.precautions: Oxidizer; eye/skin irritant; keep dry in storage; use gloves and goggles.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Dissolve per manufacturer's instructions; active at warm temperatures.

sdsURL.name: Sodium Hydroxide (Caustic Soda)
sdsURL.uses: Strips heavy grease, oils, some coatings; used in heavy-duty concrete and equipment cleaners.
sdsURL.precautions: Highly corrosive — causes severe burns and eye damage. Use acid/alkali-resistant PPE, face shield, and avoid inhalation.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Prepare diluted solutions carefully, add pellets to water slowly; never add water to pellets.

sdsURL.name: Potassium Hydroxide (KOH)
sdsURL.shortDescription: Strong alkaline used in some heavy-duty detergents.
sdsURL.uses: Degreasing and heavy cleaning where strong alkalinity is required.
sdsURL.precautions: Same as sodium hydroxide — corrosive; full PPE required.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Follow product instructions for dilution and temperature.

sdsURL.name: Trisodium Phosphate (TSP)
sdsURL.uses: Surface prep, removing built-up grime and grease before painting or sealing.
sdsURL.precautions: Irritant; environmental concerns (eutrophication). Contain rinse water and limit phosphate discharge.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Use as directed; avoid overuse near drains.

sdsURL.name: Sodium Metasilicate
sdsURL.shortDescription: Alkaline builder used in industrial cleaners.
sdsURL.uses: Boosts detergency, emulsifies oils and greases.
sdsURL.precautions: Corrosive; can cause skin/eye burns. Use gloves and eye protection.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Dissolve per label; avoid incompatible mixes.

sdsURL.name: Nonionic Surfactants (APG, alcohol ethoxylates)
sdsURL.shortDescription: Wetting agents and detergents used across many formulations.
sdsURL.uses: General-purpose cleaners; degreasers; reduce surface tension for better penetration.
sdsURL.precautions: Mild to moderate irritant; choose biodegradable types where possible.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Typically added at low concentrations per formulation guidance.

sdsURL.name: Anionic Surfactants (LAS, SLS, SLES)
sdsURL.shortDescription: Detergents for removing soils, helpful for heavy foaming systems.
sdsURL.uses: Concrete, siding, and equipment cleaners; foaming detergents.
sdsURL.precautions: Irritant at high concentrations; incompatible with cationic biocides.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Combine with amphoterics to reduce irritation and control foam.

sdsURL.name: Amphoteric Surfactants (Cocamidopropyl Betaine)
sdsURL.shortDescription: Surfactants that moderate foam and reduce irritation in blends.
sdsURL.uses: Foam boosters, mild cleansers, vehicle and surface cleaners.
sdsURL.precautions: Possible allergen for sensitive users; use PPE for concentrate handling.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Good compatibility with anionics and nonionics.

sdsURL.name: Quaternary Ammonium Compounds (Quats)
sdsURL.shortDescription: Cationic biocides used for sanitizing and algaecide applications.
sdsURL.uses: Surface disinfectants, sanitizer formulations, some algaecidal blends.
sdsURL.precautions: Irritating to skin/eyes; toxic to aquatic life; do not mix with anionic detergents or bleach.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Follow label contact times for disinfection efficacy.

sdsURL.name: Sodium Percarbonate (Oxygen Bleach)
sdsURL.shortDescription: Oxygen-based powdered bleach used as a chlorine-free bleaching agent.
sdsURL.uses: Deck/siding brightening, mildew removal where chlorine is undesirable.
sdsURL.precautions: Oxidizer; inspect for dust inhalation risk and use PPE.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Dissolve per manufacturer's guidance; active at elevated temperatures.

sdsURL.name: Hydrogen Peroxide (stabilized)
sdsURL.shortDescription: Liquid oxidizer used in some non-chlorine disinfectant systems.
sdsURL.uses: Stain removal and sanitizing as chlorine alternative.
sdsURL.precautions: Oxidizer and irritant at higher concentrations; store cool and away from organics.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Avoid mixing with metals and reducing agents.

sdsURL.name: Sodium Dichloroisocyanurate (NaDCC)
sdsURL.shortDescription: Solid chlorinated disinfectant for controlled chlorine dosing.
sdsURL.precautions: Oxidizer; avoid mixing with acids or organics; PPE required.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Store dry and handle per label instructions.

sdsURL.name: Phosphoric Acid
sdsURL.shortDescription: Acid used for rust, mineral, and scale removal.
sdsURL.uses: Rust stain removal and concrete cleaning (controlled).
sdsURL.precautions: Corrosive; use acid PPE and containment.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Neutralize and rinse after use; do not mix with oxidizers/bleach.

sdsURL.name: Oxalic Acid
sdsURL.shortDescription: Organic acid effective against rust and tannin stains.
sdsURL.uses: Rust stain treatment on masonry and wood brightening.
sdsURL.precautions: Toxic if ingested; irritant to skin/eyes; use PPE.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Use in formulated dilutions and rinse thoroughly.

sdsURL.name: Sulfamic Acid
sdsURL.shortDescription: Solid acid descaler used as a milder alternative to HCl.
sdsURL.uses: Descaling and rust stain removal where milder acid is preferred.
sdsURL.precautions: Irritant/corrosive; avoid dust and use PPE.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Dissolve per manufacturer guidance; do not mix with bleach.

sdsURL.name: Citric Acid
sdsURL.shortDescription: Mild, biodegradable organic acid for descaling and pH adjustment.
sdsURL.uses: Light descaling, rust/tannin stain removal, eco-friendlier formulations.
sdsURL.precautions: Irritant at high concentration; handle powders carefully.
sdsURL.mixingNote: Good alternative to stronger mineral acids for sensitive surfaces.
